title: Williams Sonoma packaging
content:
Anyone know any of the fonts used here?  
The script may be custom, but I'm not sure what the slab and sans are.

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154551/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154551/http:/typophile.com/files/image_111.jpg) | 20.14 KB |
author: pacedesign

comments.content:
"KNIVES" looks like **[Egizio Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154551/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=URW&ffam=Egizio%20Becker%20Cond%20-%20Regular&fid=2e8d48f0cf32058f93af79356716e3b2&fsize=60&text=KNIVES&fit=1)** by Aldo Novarese (available from URW++, Linotype, E&F...)  
"CHEESE" looks close to **[Alternate Gothic No3](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154551/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=URW&ffam=Alternate%20Gothic%20No3%20D%20-%203D&fid=1ab27b1a02a7fb1c4ebe805cff2694c3&fsize=60&text=CHEESE&fit=1)**

the script is too small for me...

Hard to tell with such a distorted and blurry sample for me. I may risk [Trade Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154551/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic) Condensed Bold post-treated for 'CHEESE'. The script is something I know but can't recall... Really can't tell for the others without a better sample...
Perhaps [Storefront Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154551/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/storefront-pro/) for the script? See the Glyphs map for similar T's.

Better pic will get you better answers. As it is, three of our best font detectives are all over the map.  
Don

Sorry for the blurry image.  
That's the best I could find, but all of you have been very helpful.  
I can go with the fonts you suggested,  
I think they are pretty accurate. Thanks again, guys!
